properties.displayName: [Deprecated]: Kubernetes clusters should gate deployment of vulnerable images
properties.description: This policy definition is no longer the recommended way to achieve its intent. Learn more about policy definition deprecation at aka.ms/policydefdeprecation.

metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.
List of Kubernetes namespaces the policy would apply to. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.
Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

schema.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all resources.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of values, a key, and an operator.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty.

metadata.description: A list of RegEx rules used to exclude container images from policy evaluation. For example: exclude all images from the repo microsoft-defender-in-cluster-defense-repo in the blockreg ACR -  ["(blockreg.azurecr.io/microsoft-defender-in-cluster-defense-repo).*"]. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all container images.

metadata.displayName: Severity threshold for excluding vulnerabilities without a patch
metadata.description: Specify the maximum severity for exempting vulnerabilities without a patch. For example, specify Medium to ignore Low and Medium vulnerabilities without a patch.
A list of finding IDs that the policy should exempt.
The number of allowed findings per severity for an image. e.g. "{"High":0,"Medium":3,"Low":10}"
